ticket.title: PCAC policy surface implementation and fail-closed defaults

tickets.reason: Policy controls target PCAC fields and deny classes defined by core schema work.
Privileged path integration surfaces must exist to apply policy knobs consistently.
Tier2+ sovereignty controls require concrete composition checks before policy hardening.

in_scope: Implement minimum RFC-0027 policy knobs for lifecycle, evidence level, freshness, and sovereignty controls.
Implement fail-closed behavior for missing/unknown policy states in authority-critical paths.
Implement PointerOnly waiver-binding, scope, and expiry behavior.
Expose policy state required by objective/gate predicate exporters.
out_of_scope: Operator workflow redesign for waiver lifecycle management.

steps: Add/patch policy configuration structs and validation for required PCAC knobs.
Wire policy decisions into RequestTool and privileged handlers with explicit deny on unknown states.
Implement waiver-binding receipt emission and immediate fail-closed behavior on waiver expiry/invalidity.
Add policy regression tests covering Tier2+ defaults and PointerOnly waiver constraints.
Run cargo fmt --all && cargo clippy --workspace --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings && cargo test --workspace.

criteria: All minimum RFC-0027 policy knobs are implemented and enforced.
Unknown policy states in authority-critical paths deny deterministically.
PointerOnly admissions are waiver-bound, expiry-enforced, and non-permissive by default at Tier2+.

notes.security: Policy defaults must remain containment-safe across all authority-bearing paths.
notes.verification: Include policy-matrix tests for Tier0/1 vs Tier2+ and waiver expiry transitions.
